caseTitle: MISCELLANY-AT-LAW MRS. JANET DANIELS RETIRES [1980] VOL. XII
summary: This document from the Review of Ghana Law (1980) commemorates the retirement of Mrs. Janet Daniels, who served as editor of the Review for sixteen years and contributed significantly to the Ghana Law Reports. She stepped down on medical grounds effective 8 April 1980, after playing a foundational role in establishing the Review's national and international reputation. Known for her rigorous editorial standards, she ensured submissions were sharp, accurate, and legally sound. She also authored important articles on topics such as statute law, trial by jury, and defamation of women. The piece expresses deep appreciation for her service and wishes her well in retirement.
rationaleHighlights: Recognition of Mrs. Janet Daniels' editorial and scholarly contributions to Ghana's legal publications
Acknowledgment of her role in shaping the Review of Ghana Law
Highlight of her authored works on key legal topics
Expression of institutional gratitude upon her retirement
confidenceNotes: The document is not a judicial decision but a commemorative note on the retirement of Mrs. Janet Daniels. Information is derived from an editorial announcement in the Review of Ghana Law.
